name: Writing and Resistance: Decolonizing Literature
description: In this course we will study literary and non-literary texts from the nineteenth century to the present day. Colonial texts will be analyzed alongside postcolonial interpretations of the nineteenth-century archive, giving students a grasp of colonial discourse and contemporary postcolonial analyses. [36L]
prerequisites: All 200-series courses are open to students who are concurrently enrolled in ENG110Y5 or ENG140Y5 or both DRE/ENG121H5 and DRE/ENG122H5 or who have completed at least 4.0 credits.
